title: Do tenacity runes even work? Are they placebo runes?
body:
With all the tenacity runes available, mercury treads and elixir of iron, you can get 76% tenacity.

And you can get rooted / stunned by champions like Morgana, Nautilus and Veigar for approximately 2 entire seconds.

Are you telling me 2 seconds is 24% of the full duration of those crowd control effects?

replies.body: iirc tenacity does not stack additively (barring a small number of combinations), but rather stacks multiplicatively. So no matter the amount of tenacity they introduce it would be impossible to get 100% tenacity. For instance Garen gets 60% tenacity just from his W alone, so Legend Tenacity+Mercs would put him over 100% if it was additive.

> [{quoted}](name=Arisen Valkyrie,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KroOmpzu,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2019-08-10T09:50:11.508+0000)
>
> iirc tenacity does not stack additively (barring a small number of combinations), but rather stacks multiplicatively. So no matter the amount of tenacity they introduce it would be impossible to get 100% tenacity. For instance Garen gets 60% tenacity just from his W alone, so Legend Tenacity+Mercs would put him over 100% if it was additive.

I don't know why you guys are preaching the OP on math when he did it (almost) correctly. Maximum tenacity with Legend: Tenacity, Mercury's Treads, Unflinching and Elixir of Iron is 75%:
0.7\*0.7\*0.68*0.75 = 0.2499

> [{quoted}](name=Arisen Valkyrie,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KroOmpzu,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2019-08-10T09:50:11.508+0000)
>
> iirc tenacity does not stack additively (barring a small number of combinations), but rather stacks multiplicatively. So no matter the amount of tenacity they introduce it would be impossible to get 100% tenacity. For instance Garen gets 60% tenacity just from his W alone, so Legend Tenacity+Mercs would put him over 100% if it was additive.

(With Slow Resistance (which stacks additively), however, it IS possible to exceed %100, and at that point slows will speed you up.)
This is indeed how it works.
On top of that, the tenacity rune in Precision stacks up over time and the other one is situational, so you're not going to get the full benefit all the time.

It has a reason why people say
_**~~This Morgana Q roots for ages..!~~**_

> [{quoted}](name=FURRY V2,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KroOmpzu,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-08-10T07:55:14.947+0000)
>
> It has a reason why people say
> _**~~This Morgana Q roots for ages..!~~**_

Its because they have no tenacity at all? 

With merc threads+legend:tenacity you´d a case looking like this : 

Stun duration reduced by merc threads then that amount reducerad by Legend:tenacity. 

((3 seconds * (0,7)) 0,7* ) = 1,47

Or for absolute clarity.

3 x 0,7 = 2,1 (first tenacity reduction)

21 x 0,7 = 1,47 (second one&final duration)


Is 1,47 a long time? Fairly so i´d say, but not really OP or UP.

>
> It has a reason why people say
> _**~~This Morgana Q roots for ages..!~~**_

Ze everoot
_**~~I don't like, i love it~~**_
Tenacity or no basically every cc in this game lasts longer than it should.
I wouldn't say that. Do you really want Master Yi running around killing everyone because you can't lock him down as well anymore?

> [{quoted}](name=Teh Song,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KroOmpzu,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-08-10T08:23:31.769+0000)
>

It kinda has to with every champion coming out with 8 dashes 3 blinds a stealth a backflip and a blowjob

> [{quoted}](name=RazorScythe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KroOmpzu,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2019-08-10T18:56:06.901+0000)
>
> If I remeber right mercury treads and elixir of iron don't actually stack. 
> 
> Now if that isn't the case then the cc is just lowered by -0.76 seconds. 
> 
> Morgana per skill point: 1.24/1.49/1.74/1.99/2.24 seconds a root
> Nautilus per skill point: 0.24/0.74/1.24 seconds a stun
> Veigar per skill point: 0.74/0.99/1.24/1.49/1.74 seconds a stun

They stack. They all stack, but mostly only multiplicatively.

That they stack only multiplicatively for the most part, should tell you, that Riot considers Tenacity to be a broken stat.



Mercs + Sterak's are additive.

Iron + the initial %10/%20 bonus from Unflinching are additive.

This actually helps a lot ... already knew that multiplicative was how they were calculated before (even believe there were some patch notes regarding that), but since those two sets are additive, that changes things.

For example, while in the the OPs example without Sterak's Gage the tenacity would be at 47% max (two summoner's activated for Unflinching), with Sterak's Gage that becomes a whopping 94% tenacity.

> [{quoted}](name=TakaDama,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KroOmpzu,comment-id=000b00000000,timestamp=2019-08-11T05:22:35.839+0000)
>
> This actually helps a lot ... already knew that multiplicative was how they were calculated before (even believe there were some patch notes regarding that), but since those two sets are additive, that changes things.
> 
> For example, while in the the OPs example without Sterak's Gage the tenacity would be at 47% max (two summoner's activated for Unflinching), with Sterak's Gage that becomes a whopping 94% tenacity.

My reckoning is: Steraks, when it activates, will give him +%25 additive to mercs only. So, assuming he has fully stacked Unflinching as well as Legends, %55 x %30 x %15 x %45 = %85 Tenacity. Considered to be virtually Unstoppable, but Steraks is a bit wonky (you don't really have control over when it procs) and this assumes a fully stacked Unflinching, which doesn't come up often without Smite. At this point, you probably run afoul of the .5s Tenacity soft cap...

With consistent tenacity sources: Legend, Mercs, Iron, then you still have quite a bit: ~%63 by midgame, and not very difficult to acquire. You basically walk right through Veigar Cage with that.
I've never noticed a difference with it, but I do notice when I don't take Bloodline or Revitalize, even in the early game.

I use to take Legend: Tenacity on Darius all the time, but was frustrated with my lack of damage and switched to Legend: Alacrity and have definitely noticed I do a lot more damage. Would make sense I don't notice the lack of the tenacity rune since most CC doesn't last long enough for it to do much on top of Mercs and Steraks.

Yeah, I would rather have the lifesteal from Bloodline as I play a lot of Trundle and he gets enough attack speed from his W, but fitting lifesteal into his build is hard without sacrificing durability.

If burst damage wasn't so crazy then tenacity would probably feel a lot better as a stat.

As someone pointed out, tenacity does not stack additively. If it did it wouldn't actually be that hard to get over 100% tenacity and become completely immune to crowd control. It works multiplicitively. Here's how you calculate it:

Morgana's Q is capable of rooting someone for 3 seconds at rank 5.

You have {{item:3111}} Mercury's Treads. Its ability lowers this duration by 30% meaning only 70% of that 3 second root applies (which is 2.1 seconds)

On top of Merc Treads, you have a fully stacked Legend: Tenacity rune. This lowers the duration of the remainder of the root by another 30% as it is a different source from the Merc Treads meaning the root will now only last for 1.47 seconds. By contrast if tenacity were additive then the root would last for 1.2 seconds instead.

It took me a while to figure out how this works, too. Like armor, additional sources of tenacity give diminishing returns and as such there isn't really much point in stacking all the sources you can get your hands on unless you're having a MASSIVE problem with the enemy locking you down with all of their CC. If you're, say, {{champion:122}} Darius, then Merc Treads and {{item:3053}} Sterak's Gage should be all the tenacity you need (With an Elixir if those two are still not enough).

Any champion can get %77 Tenacity from mercs, Legend:Tenacity, Elixer of Iron, and fully stacked Unflinching. (This will just begin to scrape the .5s Tenacity hard cap on a 2s CC.)

Without the Unflinching it's still a reliable %63. We haven't bothered to include Sterak's procs, or Cleanse.

That's %63 Tenacity from 3 sources that are pretty easy to have all together by midgame.


Smite DOES proc Unflinching. You can maintain a fairly consistent (well, on-demand, but easy to get) %32 Tenacity without mercs, just by running Unflinching and Smite.


The %10/%20 component of Unflinching does stack additively with Elixer of Iron. One advantage of Unflinching is that you have full use of it lvl 1. Legend Tenacity probably takes about 12m to fully stack.

They do work. The problem is, generally Tenacity caps at 51% unless you are some champ with an additional tenacity based skill.

P.S. You're imagining things if you think Morg on 73% Tenacity roots for 2 seconds. More like 1.2 or so seconds.

> [{quoted}](name=Illabethe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KroOmpzu,comment-id=0015,timestamp=2019-09-01T16:21:45.551+0000)
>
> They do work. The problem is, generally Tenacity caps at 51% unless you are some champ with an additional tenacity based skill.
> 
> P.S. You're imagining things if you think Morg on 73% Tenacity roots for 2 seconds. More like 1.2 or so seconds.

The Tenacity cap is not %51. You can stack it as high as you want, but the CC will not get reduced below .5s (unless as you say, an innate Tenacity ability is active).

Nasus has a 5s slow. You'd need %90 tenacity to get it down to the soft cap .5s.

The problem is that most tenacity sources do not stack additively.

I'm not saying there's a cap. I'm saying that without extra skills, rune investment, the general max is 51%/63% if you have Elixir of Iron. Mundo/Garen can get higher and Unflinching + Legend: Tenacity can get a little higher, but not much.

> [{quoted}](name=Illabethe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KroOmpzu,comment-id=001500000000,timestamp=2019-09-01T17:16:18.643+0000)
>
> The problem is that most tenacity sources do not stack additively.
> 
> I'm not saying there's a cap. I'm saying that without extra skills, rune investment, the general max is 51%/63% if you have Elixir of Iron. Mundo/Garen can get higher and Unflinching + Legend: Tenacity can get a little higher, but not much.

If you've been reading, any champion can get consistent %63 Tenacity by midgame from just Legend + Mercs + Iron. Adding Unflinching could get that to %77. Bringing Cleanse and having anything else makes basically unstoppable for a few seconds. 

Mercs and Iron alone is pretty common and that gets to %48...

...

Oh. That's what you meant. Yeah.
{{champion:2}} Math? Ha!

Tbh i found buyng tenacity pointless..
With this ammount of cc we have in this game, it doesent make any difference.
You will get hit by 1 cc, there will be more on the way, and even 1-2 seconds of being unable to move is death sentence.
Tenacity Runes don't start off fully stacked, and you won't have Elixirs of Iron until super late game.  Having all three at once is highly unlikely.

Post clip...

You are just making things up.
He's not making it up. He just doesn't understand how tenacity works.

I have zero clue why you're being downvoted. This guy is straight out claiming that Morgana root takes "approximately 2 entire seconds" with 76% Tenacity with no proof whatsoever. His claims are simply not true and make no sense, anyone can go test it right now in a custom game and see that it takes around one second. Maybe he misunderstood how Tenacity works, but even then it does not take two seconds with Merc's + Runes.

> [{quoted}](name=CrazyMonkeyCZ,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=KroOmpzu,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-08-10T07:30:24.030+0000)

>

Try what? That things are working? I know they do, this dude is just making it up.
I tried it. Things are working as expected. OP is making shit up.

The reason Tenacity is worthless is because so many CC abilities aren't affected by it at this point.  

Same reason resistance stats have become less valuable over time, as there's an over abundance of true damage in the game.
Not necessarily. A little bit of tenacity can go a long way, but only a little bit. The problem is diminishing returns makes it pointless to stack.
Whatever they work, they look pretty underpowered, as the current (2 year old) burst meta establishes.
They need to reduce Knockback, bar certain displacement abilities such as grabs, hooks or throws.

they work they just aren't useful where you think they would be useful.
and they are useful where you wouldn't think they would be useful.

tenacity has a limit like CDR has a limit

i dont remember the tenacity limit
Iirc, All CC effects cannot be reduced below 0.5 seconds even with 100% tenacity.

The Morgana stun always feels like it takes ages because of the hitbox is bigger than what is telegraphed visually.

Same with Nautilus' hook.
math
I mean, unless they are, in fact, bugged, I think you aren't actually being stunned for 2 seconds. And if indeed they don't work, there is a "Report a Bug" section in the forums.
It does
Over half the CC in this game is Knockups / displacements. Tenacity doesn't effect that. So move away from the rune till Tenacity reduce knockups like it should have since season 1...
